links.title: Reaction Speed: "She... really had that on the tip o..."
links.text: She... really had that on the tip of her tongue. It's like she has the timeline laid out *right* in front of her.
links.title: You: ""That sounds like a very long time.""
links.text: "That sounds like a very long time."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""It does, doesn't it? And yet there..."
links.text: "It does, doesn't it? And yet there remains a great deal to be done in that span."
links.title: You: ""That sounds like an *impossibly* l..."
links.text: "That sounds like an *impossibly* long time."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""That depends on how you look at it..."
links.text: "That depends on how you look at it. Since the Perikarnassian Incident, there have been nearly 8,000 years of recorded history..."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Viewed from that perspective, we a..."
links.text: "Viewed from that perspective, we are nearly three-quarters of the way there."
links.title: You: ""Something tells me we have less ti..."
links.text: "Something tells me we have less time than that. Like, a *lot* less time."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Of course, the number 3,000 repres..."
links.text: "Of course, the number 3,000 represents the average of a great number of projections. The actual number might be closer to 2,800 or even 2,750, depending on the contingencies..."
links.title: You: ""Three-thousand years is just the b..."
links.text: "Three-thousand years is just the blink of an eye. We need much more than that."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Of course, the number 3,000 repres..."
links.text: "Of course, the number 3,000 represents the average of a great number of projections. The actual number might be closer to 3,250 or even 3,300, depending on the contingencies..."
links.title: You: ""That sounds about right, actually.""
links.text: "That sounds about right, actually."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""It is in all senses the most moder..."
links.text: "It is in all senses the most moderate and reasonable projection possible based on current science."
links.title: You: "(Say nothing, just look around.)"
links.text: (Say nothing, just look around.)
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The wind is pulling at the giant ta..."
links.text: The wind is pulling at the giant tarps that cover the blasted facade of the Capeside Apartments.
links.title: Shivers: "Air moving through what was once a..."
links.text: Air moving through what was once a row of apartments protected by walls and a roof. It sighs through the remains of bedrooms and parlours...
links.title: Shivers: "DON'T FORSAKE ME, OFFICER. I AM YOU..."
links.text: DON'T FORSAKE ME, OFFICER. I AM YOUR RESPONSIBILITY JUST AS YOU ARE MINE.
links.title: Shivers: "THIS IS YOUR CITY. DEFEND IT AT ALL..."
links.text: THIS IS YOUR CITY. DEFEND IT AT ALL COSTS.
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "A moment of hissing static as the c..."
links.text: A moment of hissing static as the conversation lulls.
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Firewalker, are you still there?""
links.text: "Firewalker, are you still there?"

links.title: You: ""Impossible.""
links.text: "Impossible."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""It is possible. We grew up there...."
links.text: "It is possible. We grew up there. We have seen the lattice with our own eyes."

links.title: You: ""When is real democracy coming to R..."
links.text: "When is real democracy coming to Revachol?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We can assure you, it is coming as..."
links.text: "We can assure you, it is coming as soon as possible."

links.title: You: ""In a few months, then?""
links.text: "In a few months, then?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""That's... rather optimistic. Thoug..."
links.text: "That's... rather optimistic. Though of course it depends on the contingencies."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean 'contingencies'?""
links.text: "What do you mean 'contingencies'?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""You must understand, the Moralinte..."
links.text: "You must understand, the Moralintern is responsible for ensuring the continuance and flourishing of mankind for the next 3,000 years. The planning division must account for a great many possible outcomes and chance events."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Fortunately, we have contingency s..."
links.text: "Fortunately, we have contingency spreads to help guide our decision making."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Originally developed by mechanical..."
links.text: Originally developed by mechanical engineers at the Isherwood Branch of CZU Industries around the turn of the last century, contingency spreads are used to model complex events in a number of fields, including business, public health, radiocomputer science, insurance, and international diplomacy.

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Of course, there is no one spread..."
links.text: "Of course, there is no one spread that can reasonably account for all these possible events. But at least we're able to prepare for the most likely eventualities."

links.title: You: ""Wait, how do these contingency spr..."
links.text: "Wait, how do these contingency spreads actually *work*?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""It's not really our area of expert..."
links.text: "It's not really our area of expertise, but we can try to explain. Picture a smooth hill made from fresh dirt. Now, if you stand atop this hill and pour a glass of water over it, what will happen?"

links.title: You: ""The dirt will get wet?""
links.text: "The dirt will get wet?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: "A sigh. "You are thinking about thi..."
links.text: A sigh. "You are thinking about this metaphor too literally..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""The point is that we know only tha..."
links.text: "The point is that we know only that the water will run down, but not what course it will take. If we place a rock in the water's path, will it divert to the left or the right? We cannot say, but we may predict which way it might run in either event..."

links.title: You: ""I won't have any water?""
links.text: "I won't have any water?"

links.title: You: ""The water will run down the hill?""
links.text: "The water will run down the hill?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Precisamente. We know only that it..."
links.text: "Precisamente. We know only that it will run down, but not what course it will take. If we place a rock in the water's path, will it divert to the left or the right? We cannot say, but we may predict which way it might run in either event..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""That is the essence of the idea. Y..."
links.text: "That is the essence of the idea. You might also imagine these spreads as a kind of tree, with every juncture representing a different event, and every branch representing a different timeline."

links.title: You: ""You're saying the Moralintern uses..."
links.text: "You're saying the Moralintern uses contingency spreads to see the future?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Not exactly. No one can know the f..."
links.text: "Not exactly. No one can know the future. But with contingency spreads it is possible to predict what the future realities *might reasonably* look like."

links.title: Logic: "Meaning there are more and less rea..."
links.text: Meaning there are more and less reasonable futures. You should follow up on that.

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""But we shouldn't overstate their i..."
links.text: "But we shouldn't overstate their importance. They are simply one of many tools used by the Moralintern to set policy."

links.title: You: ""Hold on, does that mean some reali..."
links.text: "Hold on, does that mean some realities are *less reasonable* than others?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Well, yes -- just as some events a..."
links.text: "Well, yes -- just as some events are less probable than others. While we expect the vast majority of realities will fall within a normal confidence interval, there must necessarily be some that fall *outside that range* as well."

links.title: You: ""This is... a lot to take in.""
links.text: "This is... a lot to take in."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Of course. We're only a second sig..."
links.text: "Of course. We're only a second signaller, not a metaphysician. We sometimes find it overwhelming also..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""The key, we believe, is to be open..."
links.text: "The key, we believe, is to be open to meaning even amidst great uncertainty. But now we are only speaking for ourselves."

links.title: You: ""Would you say the reality we're li..."
links.text: "Would you say the reality we're living in is more or less reasonable than others?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Who are we to say? We're only a se..."
links.text: "Who are we to say? We're only a second signaller, not a metaphysician. This is the only reality we have ever known, so how can we judge how reasonable it might be compared to any other?"

links.title: You: ""Someone told me we live in a preca..."
links.text: "Someone told me we live in a precarious world, that every event is just a violent roll of the die."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""It may be. We're only a second sig..."
links.text: "It may be. We're only a second signaller, not a metaphysician. It's a rather cold way to think about the world, isn't it?"

links.title: You: ""So where does Revachol fit into th..."
links.text: "So where does Revachol fit into these contingencies?" (Proceed.)

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""That's impossible to say. It may b..."
links.text: "That's impossible to say. It may be that Revachol has a great role to play, or no role at all. That is the nature of contingencies."

links.title: Inland Empire: "But... didn't the Wild Pines repres..."
links.text: But... didn't the Wild Pines representative say that Revachol would *resolve* history?

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""You must understand, when we speak..."
links.text: "You must understand, when we speak of contingency spreads, we are talking about *the most fantastically complex* data visualisations human beings are capable of producing, with thousands of events -- from elections and wars to natural disasters or scientific miracles -- and millions of possible outcomes."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "*Hyyyngh!* It makes your brain swel..."
links.text: *Hyyyngh!* It makes your brain swell just to think about...

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""It may be the case that, under cer..."
links.text: "It may be the case that, under certain scenarios, Revachol is vitally important, as it was during the Coalition landings in '08. It may also be the case in many other equally plausible scenarios that Revachol is simply another once-great city, like countless others throughout history."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Did she... just admit that the Coal..."
links.text: Did she... just admit that the Coalition invading Revachol was one of those 'contingencies'?

links.title: You: ""Are you saying the Coalition invas..."
links.text: "Are you saying the Coalition invasion was one of these 'contingencies'?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""No -- well, not quite. The Moralin..."
links.text: "No -- well, not quite. The Moralintern never *intends* to violate another nation's sovereignty. That would be a serious violation of international law..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""But one must consider that the wor..."
links.text: "But one must consider that the world was in the midst of a global catastrophe brought on by an unstoppable pandemic. No amount of contingency planning could account for *all of that*."

links.title: You: ""So you're saying we *are* living i..."
links.text: "So you're saying we *are* living in an unreasonable reality!"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We are living in the only reality..."
links.text: "We are living in the only reality we know. Our task is to make the best of it that we can..."

links.title: You: ""So you're saying the Moralintern h..."
links.text: "So you're saying the Moralintern had to make difficult decisions during an unprecedented situation."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Yes, we would say that is a fair a..."
links.text: "Yes, we would say that is a fair and reasonable way to describe it..."

links.title: You: ""So you're saying the Moralintern j..."
links.text: "So you're saying the Moralintern just had to wing it?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Only in the sense that the entire..."
links.text: "Only in the sense that the entire world has to 'wing' its way through history. The Moralintern simply aims to 'wing it' as little as possible..."

links.title: You: ""I still feel like there had to hav..."
links.text: "I still feel like there had to have been a better way."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Almost certainly. Not many realise..."
links.text: "Almost certainly. Not many realise this, but, the Moralintern is constantly reviewing and revising its contingency spreads in order to improve our own decision-making..."

links.title: You: ""History loves to rhyme. I'll bet R..."
links.text: "History loves to rhyme. I'll bet Revachol has its day again."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Perhaps, perhaps not. Could the Pe..."
links.text: "Perhaps, perhaps not. Could the Perikarnassians have foreseen the role Revachol would play in events to come? In truth, history only appears to rhyme because we cannot perceive events in their full complexity..."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "All major cities in EPIS-aligned na..."
links.text: All major cities in EPIS-aligned nations, you can't help but notice.

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""It's even possible the cities that..."
links.text: "It's even possible the cities that will resolve the questions of the future have not been founded yet."

links.title: You: "(Look around.) "Yeah, this is defin..."
links.text: (Look around.) "Yeah, this is definitely a place whose time has passed."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Impossible to say for certain. Hum..."
links.text: "Impossible to say for certain. Human beings are notoriously bad at predicting all the different ways events might unravel..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""For this reason, responsibility fo..."
links.text: "For this reason, responsibility for developing contingency spreads is only assigned to highly trained analysts working with advanced radiocomputers and a steady supply of drouamine."

links.title: You: ""Okay, but I *still* want to know w..."
links.text: "Okay, but I *still* want to know when real democracy is coming."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Of course. While the content of in..."
links.text: "Of course. While the content of individual contingency spreads is deeply classified, many degrees beyond our access, everything we have heard from the Provisional Commission indicates that the transition is proceeding according to the appropriate timetable."
links.title: You: ""Does that mean democracy is *here*..."
links.text: "Does that mean democracy is *here*?" (Look around.)
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Well, not yet. Right now it's more..."
links.text: "Well, not yet. Right now it's more like a simple seed, buried out of sight..."
links.title: You: ""What are you talking about?""
links.text: "What are you talking about?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""The first phase of democratisation.""
links.text: "The first phase of democratisation."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Soon, the people of Revachol will..."
links.text: "Soon, the people of Revachol will vote for slates of candidates who will make up the transitional advisory council that will oversee the second phase of democratisation."
links.title: You: ""What's this 'transitional advisory..."
links.text: "What's this 'transitional advisory council'?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""The council is modelled after simi..."
links.text: "The council is modelled after similar bodies developed in a number of transitional democracies. Its role is to devise and shape the future institutions of Revacholian democracy, according to local conditions..."
links.title: Rhetoric: "'Local conditions' in this case ref..."
links.text: 'Local conditions' in this case referring to incompetence, graft, and violence.
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Once elected, council members will..."
links.text: "Once elected, council members will even have the opportunity to join one of several officially sanctioned political wings, depending on their ideological beliefs and policy preferences."
links.title: You: ""What do these 'wings' represent?""
links.text: "What do these 'wings' represent?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""A very important question. The win..."
links.text: "A very important question. The wings are carefully selected to represent a wide spectrum of political thought."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Typically, there's a liberal techn..."
links.text: "Typically, there's a liberal technocratic wing, a social democratic wing, and even a conservative populist wing. You wouldn't believe some of the ideas they express! But a vibrant and free political culture requires that all perspectives be given voice, even those many may find objectionable."
links.title: You: ""Who picks the slates of candidates?""
links.text: "Who picks the slates of candidates?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""In most cases, the Provisional Cou..."
links.text: "In most cases, the Provisional Council selects them from a cross-section of the local population to ensure the slates actually reflect the people they represent."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Of course, such a situation is not..."
links.text: "Of course, such a situation is not ideal. We would all prefer for Revacholians to nominate their representatives directly. But that is why it's a transitional council."
links.title: You: ""How many of these 'phases' are the..."
links.text: "How many of these 'phases' are there until we have real democracy?" (Conclude.)
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Our best theoreticians believe tha..."
links.text: "Our best theoreticians believe that three to five phases are appropriate for states that lack strong democratic traditions, which would certainly apply to Revachol."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""But we must stress that real democ..."
links.text: "But we must stress that real democracy is an ongoing process and not simply an outcome. It must be cultivated and preserved if it is to endure."
links.title: You: ""Like the city of Advesperascit, yo..."
links.text: "Like the city of Advesperascit, you mean."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Esattamente.""
links.text: "Esattamente."
links.title: You: ""I met a gardener earlier, but then..."
links.text: "I met a gardener earlier, but then she turned out to be a lawyer. Is she involved somehow?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Gardeners and lawyers are both ess..."
links.text: "Gardeners and lawyers are both essential to a beautiful and well-functioning society, but we're referring to something else..."
links.title: You: ""But what if some people want democ..."
links.text: "But what if some people want democracy to come *faster*?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""That is extremely admirable. Of co..."
links.text: "That is extremely admirable. Of course, the Coalition supports the Revacholian people's desire for full democracy. We encourage you to contact the offices of the Provisional Commission if you are serious about getting involved."
links.title: You: ""How can I get involved?""
links.text: "How can I get involved?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Oh, there are many things you can..."
links.text: "Oh, there are many things you can do. If you're interested in learning how to canvass for signatures, manage a polling place, or register voters, the Commission would be more than happy to direct you to a workshop..."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""In fact, you may have picked the p..."
links.text: "In fact, you may have picked the perfect time to get involved: Revachol is nearly ready to begin the first phase of democratisation."
links.title: You: ""But what if I want real democracy,..."
links.text: "But what if I want real democracy, like, *right* now?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Well, that isn't very realistic, i..."
links.text: "Well, that isn't very realistic, is it?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Real democracy doesn't just happen..."
links.text: "Real democracy doesn't just happen. It requires the support of a great number of stable, interlocking institutions. *That* is the only way to channel popular sentiment into a legitimate mandate to govern. Otherwise, what are we left with?"
links.title: You: ""Mob rule?""
links.text: "Mob rule?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Esattamente. But the Commission's..."
links.text: "Esattamente. But the Commission's hard and diligent work may soon be bearing fruit: Revachol is nearly ready to begin the first phase of democratisation."
links.title: You: ""An institutional crisis?""
links.text: "An institutional crisis?"

links.title: You: ""How do I access my *personal conti..."
links.text: "How do I access my *personal contingency spread*?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Even though we are only a second s..."
links.text: "Even though we are only a second signaller, we can tell you with great certainty that there is no contingency spread for you, Firewalker."
links.title: Inland Empire: "S-s-s-she knows perfectly well wher..."
links.text: S-s-s-she knows perfectly well where they are! They've got one for everybody, all coded and filed away in a vast labyrinth beneath Isherwood...
links.title: You: ""Are you sure? I bet it's locked aw..."
links.text: "Are you sure? I bet it's locked away in a vault somewhere..."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""The Moralintern is not Seol. There..."
links.text: "The Moralintern is not Seol. There is no secret vault of files beneath Isherwood or La Cherte or anywhere else, because that is not the Moralintern's purpose..."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Our concerns exist on the scale of..."
links.text: "Our concerns exist on the scale of decades, centuries, and millennia. Sometimes we say the Moralintern worries about the future so that normal people may worry about today."
links.title: You: ""That sounds like a moderate and re..."
links.text: "That sounds like a moderate and reasonable way to organise a society."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""It is a work-in-progress, but it i..."
links.text: "It is a work-in-progress, but it is also the best way that humanity has found thus far."
links.title: You: ""But what if I *want* someone else..."
links.text: "But what if I *want* someone else to make all my decisions for me?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""What you are describing is the att..."
links.text: "What you are describing is the attitude of a child. The Moralintern is not 'humanity's stepmother', despite what some critics may allege. Responsibility and freedom are deeply entwined, and both are essential in a flourishing society."
links.title: You: ""You must be mistaken. I'm kind of..."
links.text: "You must be mistaken. I'm kind of a star around here."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Perhaps you are confused as to the..."
links.text: "Perhaps you are confused as to the scale on which the contingency spreads function..."
links.title: You: ""Is it because I'm a miserable fail..."
links.text: "Is it because I'm a miserable failure?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Of course not. The Moralintern is..."
links.text: "Of course not. The Moralintern is committed to giving every person the opportunity to flourish..."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Please understand, we are not some..."
links.text: "Please understand, we are not some totalitarian enterprise. We are committed to and bound by the highest values of individual freedom and opportunity."
links.title: You: ""That's impossible. I am the doomsi..."
links.text: "That's impossible. I am the doomsinger, the herald of desolation."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We're sorry, we're not familiar wi..."
links.text: "We're sorry, we're not familiar with all the local offices in Martinaise..."
links.title: You: ""What do you mean?'"
links.text: "What do you mean?'
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Simply that there is no such thing..."
links.text: "Simply that there is no such thing as an individual contingency spread..."

links.title: You: ""Enough of this. I have another que..."
links.text: "Enough of this. I have another question."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Acknowledged. We are at your dispo..."
links.text: "Acknowledged. We are at your disposal."

links.title: You: ""Why does thinking about these cont..."
links.text: "Why does thinking about these contingencies make me feel so *bad*?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""It's completely natural. Studies h..."
links.text: "It's completely natural. Studies have shown that the untrained mind is only capable of considering so many possibilities in place at once, usually no more than three or four..."

links.title: You: ""Within a couple of years, surely.""
links.text: "Within a couple of years, surely."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""That's certainly possible. Though..."
links.text: "That's certainly possible. Though of course it depends on the contingencies."

links.title: You: ""Within my lifetime?""
links.text: "Within my lifetime?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Oh, most likely. Though of course..."
links.text: "Oh, most likely. Though of course it depends on the contingencies."

links.title: You: ""Listen, I really need to reach the..."
links.text: "Listen, I really need to reach the Committee of Responsibility." (Proceed.)

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Acknowledged. To reach the Committ..."
links.text: "Acknowledged. To reach the Committee, all you need to do is fill out the appropriate request form and submit it to the liaison for public affairs."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""If the liaison accepts your reques..."
links.text: "If the liaison accepts your request, you will be invited to address the Committee at their next quarterly public hearing. We believe the next hearing is scheduled for July." She seems very satisfied by this answer.

links.title: Half Light: "She's gotta be jerking your chain,..."
links.text: She's gotta be jerking your chain, right? You can't wait that long!

links.title: You: ""What if I need to reach the Commit..."
links.text: "What if I need to reach the Committee *a bit sooner*?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Not a problem. If this is a *time-..."
links.text: "Not a problem. If this is a *time-sensitive* matter, you may file an emergency address request with the liaison for public affairs."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""They typically respond within a fe..."
links.text: "They typically respond within a few weeks."

links.title: You: ""Actually, I was hoping you could p..."
links.text: "Actually, I was hoping you could patch me through to the Committee *directly*."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We're afraid that is quite impossi..."
links.text: "We're afraid that is quite impossible, Firewalker."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We cannot transfer you to the Comm..."
links.text: "We cannot transfer you to the Committee because we are not entrusted with that responsibility. We are simply the second signaller."

links.title: Authority: "Then why are you wasting time with..."
links.text: Then why are you wasting time with *her*? You should demand to speak with who's *really* in charge.

links.title: You: ""I *demand* you transfer me to your..."
links.text: "I *demand* you transfer me to your superior -- immediately!"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: "You think you hear a faint sigh com..."
links.text: You think you hear a faint sigh coming from the other end of the connection...

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""You know that is simply not how th..."
links.text: "You know that is simply not how the command pyramid works. We can no more overrule our chief signaller than you could overrule your own precinct captain."

links.title: You: ""Listen, I'm begging you, *please*..."
links.text: "Listen, I'm begging you, *please* just let me through..."

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
You: ""Archer, are you there?""
links.text: "Archer, are you there?"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We're here, Firewalker. Though we..."
links.text: "We're here, Firewalker. Though we have to say, this is all quite *out-of-sequence*..."

links.title: You: ""I get it. So the real power is eve..."
links.text: "I get it. So the real power is even *higher* up."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""That is the nature of the command..."
links.text: "That is the nature of the command pyramid, yes. Most modern organisations work in a similar way, even the RCM."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""This line of argument is quite poi..."
links.text: "This line of argument is quite pointless. You should abandon it."

links.title: Noid: ""You're getting out-tangled by the..."
links.text: "You're getting out-tangled by the Big Bad. Time to try something else."

links.title: You: "Convince her you need to address th..."
links.text: Convince her you need to address the Committee.

links.title: Empathy: "This isn't about you, not really. I..."
links.text: This isn't about you, not really. It may have been at a certain point, but you've let go of that perspective. This is about your responsibility to *all* of Revachol.

links.title: Empathy: "Now, take a deep breath... look upw..."
links.text: Now, take a deep breath... look upward... you don't have to bear the burden alone.

links.title: You: ""Listen to me, the situation in Mar..."
links.text: "Listen to me, the situation in Martinaise is a powderkeg. If the Coalition doesn't intervene, many people will die."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""What? How do you know this?""
links.text: "What? How do you know this?"

links.title: Composure: "There's a hesitation in her voice n..."
links.text: There's a hesitation in her voice now, a little catch that wasn't there before...

links.title: You: ""I was recently caught in a violent..."
links.text: "I was recently caught in a violent confrontation between the Union and a group of mercenaries hired by the Wild Pines..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Firewalker, this is a very serious..."
links.text: "Firewalker, this is a very serious claim. Please describe the situation as succinctly as possible. We will forward your summary to the Committee."

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "There's papers rustling in the back..."
links.text: There's papers rustling in the background. She's clearing her desk, preparing to take notes.

links.title: Empathy: "There, you've wedged your foot in t..."
links.text: There, you've wedged your foot in the door. Now, if you can show the Coalition how much they're *needed*, they'll have no choice but to intervene.

links.title: Logic: "You have the facts. Just lay them o..."
links.text: You have the facts. Just lay them out beneath the cold light of reason.

links.title: You: ""The Wild Pines completely failed t..."
links.text: "The Wild Pines completely failed to control the paramilitary death squad they hired..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Please continue. We're listening."..."
links.text: "Please continue. We're listening." You can hear her furiously scribbling notes...

links.title: You: ""And now there are multiple casualt..."
links.text: "And now there are multiple casualties on both sides of the conflict. The harbour is locked down, the Wild Pines rep is gone. It's... very bad."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Good god. Is there anything else t..."
links.text: "Good god. Is there anything else the Committee should know?" You hear the sound of a page turning, followed by fierce scribbling.
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, before you answer that,..."
links.text: "Detective, before you answer that, I urge you to weigh your words *extremely* carefully."
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You're not only speaking for yourse..."
links.text: You're not only speaking for yourself, he means to tell you, you're speaking for all of the RCM. What you say now will reflect on all of your half-brothers and sisters.
links.title: Rhetoric: "The lieutenant is afraid you're goi..."
links.text: The lieutenant is afraid you're going to say something too *outré*.
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "If the lieutenant were here, he wou..."
links.text: If the lieutenant were here, he would remind you that you don't speak only for yourself but the entire RCM. What you say now will reflect on all of your half-brothers and sisters.
links.title: You: ""Now that you mention it, I learned..."
links.text: "Now that you mention it, I learned something *very* strange about the victim in my murder investigation..."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We're listening. What did you lear..."
links.text: "We're listening. What did you learn about the victim?"
links.title: You: ""He said it was *communism* that ki..."
links.text: "He said it was *communism* that killed him."
links.title: Empathy: "Oh dear, you seem to be losing the..."
links.text: Oh dear, you seem to be losing the thread...
links.title: Rhetoric: "Don't listen to them, *everyone* lo..."
links.text: Don't listen to them, *everyone* loves a good political angle.
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Come again, Firewalker? You're say..."
links.text: "Come again, Firewalker? You're saying the victim was killed by communists? Was this a politically motivated homicide?"
links.title: You: ""Yeah, that's my working hypothesis.""
links.text: "Yeah, that's my working hypothesis."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Acknowledged. But there's still so..."
links.text: "Acknowledged. But there's still something we don't understand: Did you speak with the victim *before* his death?"
links.title: You: ""Uh, right, we spoke beforehand.""
links.text: "Uh, right, we spoke beforehand."
links.title: You: ""Nope, after.""
links.text: "Nope, after."
links.title: You: ""Let's say I have my ways of knowin..."
links.text: "Let's say I have my ways of knowing these things."
links.title: You: ""It wasn't communists, it was *comm..."
links.text: "It wasn't communists, it was *communism* itself that killed him."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We're afraid we're not following...."
links.text: "We're afraid we're not following. Did you speak with the victim *before* his death?"
links.title: You: ""I want to be very precise: communi..."
links.text: "I want to be very precise: communism may have killed him, but it was *love* did him in."
links.title: You: ""He said it was *love* that did him..."
links.text: "He said it was *love* that did him in."
links.title: Empathy: "Oh dear, you seem to be losing the..."
links.text: Oh dear, you seem to be losing the thread...
links.title: Electrochemistry: "No way. Sex and death is what it's..."
links.text: No way. Sex and death is what it's *all* about.
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Come again, Firewalker? You're say..."
links.text: "Come again, Firewalker? You're saying that the victim was killed in some sort of... romantic imbroglio?"
links.title: You: ""That's right. It was love, for sur..."
links.text: "That's right. It was love, for sure. He told me himself."
links.title: You: ""I don't know that love *killed* hi..."
links.text: "I don't know that love *killed* him, but it definitely did him in."
links.title: You: ""I want to be very precise: it was..."
links.text: "I want to be very precise: it was love that did him in, but it was *communism* that killed him."
links.title: You: ""I heard that something 'miraculous..."
links.text: "I heard that something 'miraculous' was coming, from way out west."
links.title: Empathy: "Oh dear, you seem to be losing the..."
links.text: Oh dear, you seem to be losing the thread...
links.title: Inland Empire: "No, this is right. Who doesn't long..."
links.text: No, this is right. Who doesn't long to believe in *miracles*?
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Come again? Something 'miraculous,..."
links.text: "Come again? Something 'miraculous,' you say?"
links.title: You: ""From the northwest, specifically.""
links.text: "From the northwest, specifically."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We're afraid we aren't quite follo..."
links.text: "We're afraid we aren't quite following. *Who* told you all this, exactly?"
links.title: You: ""I'm not really sure. Maybe the hai..."
links.text: "I'm not really sure. Maybe the hairs along my arm? I'm still trying to figure that part out."
links.title: You: ""Listen, it's the miracle that matt..."
links.text: "Listen, it's the miracle that matters. Did you write that part down at least?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""No, Firewalker, we did not.""
links.text: "No, Firewalker, we did not."
links.title: You: ""I don't understand it, either, but..."
links.text: "I don't understand it, either, but that's what I heard."
links.title: You: ""Yes, I've also discovered an entro..."
links.text: "Yes, I've also discovered an entroponetic phenomenon here in Martinaise."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""... We're afraid we must ask you t..."
links.text: "... We're afraid we must ask you to repeat that, Firewalker."
links.title: Inland Empire: "A-a-afraid? What is she afraid of?"
links.text: A-a-afraid? What is she afraid of?
links.title: Empathy: "Her tone has shifted. She's no long..."
links.text: Her tone has shifted. She's no longer herself.
links.title: Composure: "She's reading from a script. Your w..."
links.text: She's reading from a script. Your words have activated some sort of *procedure*.
links.title: You: ""I said, 'I've discovered an entrop..."
links.text: "I said, 'I've discovered an entroponetic phenomenon here in Martinaise'."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Acknowledged. Listen very carefull..."
links.text: "Acknowledged. Listen very carefully, Firewalker. We are going to ask you a series of questions. It is imperative that you answer as directly and truthfully as you can. Do you understand?"
links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Good. First question: Are you curr..."
links.text: "Good. First question: Are you currently in the vicinity of Sereglee, the North Arcade Islands, or Near Pale Offshore Platform 'Insulindico'?"
links.title: You: ""I've never heard of any of those p..."
links.text: "I've never heard of any of those places."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Please answer the question.""
links.text: "Please answer the question."
links.title: You: ""You already know exactly where I a..."
links.text: "You already know exactly where I am."
links.title: You: ""No, I'm in Martinaise.""
links.text: "No, I'm in Martinaise."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Very good. Next question: Would yo..."
links.text: "Very good. Next question: Would you describe the phenomenon as *internal* to the isola, or *external* to the isola?"
links.title: Conceptualization: "What she means is... actually... yo..."
links.text: What she means is... actually... you have no idea what those words could mean in this context...
links.title: You: ""Internal.""
links.text: "Internal."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Next question: At the time, did yo..."
links.text: "Next question: At the time, did you experience *sense objects*?"
links.title: You: ""Uh... can you elaborate?""
links.text: "Uh... can you elaborate?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Yes. Examples may include sound, m..."
links.text: "Yes. Examples may include sound, memory, light."
links.title: You: ""It was a kind of gradient.""
links.text: "It was a kind of gradient."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Mhmm. Let's go on...""
links.text: "Mhmm. Let's go on..."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Final question: Were you alone?""
links.text: "Final question: Were you alone?"
links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes. Unquestionably, *irrevocably*..."
links.text: Yes. Unquestionably, *irrevocably* alone...
links.title: Logic: "Of course not. The radio-programmer..."
links.text: Of course not. The radio-programmer was there...
links.title: Savoir Faire: "How could you be alone? You're a *s..."
links.text: How could you be alone? You're a *star*, man. You've got an *entourage* and adoring fans wherever you go...
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You are part of a large family. You..."
links.text: You are part of a large family. You are never alone...
links.title: Empathy: "There's no need to overthink this."
links.text: There's no need to overthink this.
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We repeat: Were you alone?""
links.text: "We repeat: Were you alone?"
links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: "..."
Perception (Hearing): "You hear the sound of a page rippin..."
links.text: You hear the sound of a page ripping.
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Thank you, Firewalker. Please stan..."
links.text: "Thank you, Firewalker. Please stand by while we transmit our summary..."
links.title: You: ""No.""
links.text: "No."
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "That reminds you, where has your ha..."
links.text: That reminds you, where has your half-brother gone?
links.title: Shivers: "You are the Doom-Speaker. It is you..."
links.text: You are the Doom-Speaker. It is your lot to ply these somnolent roads, declaring your lonely truth...
links.title: Authority: "You don't need anybody else. You're..."
links.text: You don't need anybody else. You're the *lawbringer*...
links.title: Conceptualization: "Your head is so full of colourful t..."
links.text: Your head is so full of colourful thoughts, you never *feel* alone...
links.title: Drama: "How could you expect anyone to stay..."
links.text: How could you expect anyone to stay around with all your *standard-issue* thoughts and opinions?
links.title: You: ""I can only describe it in terms of..."
links.text: "I can only describe it in terms of curdling milk."
links.title: You: ""When the raver put the compressor..."
links.text: "When the raver put the compressor through the other thing, it made the beat really hard core. Like, *too* hard core."
links.title: You: ""I experienced nothing. A complete..."
links.text: "I experienced nothing. A complete lack of phenomena."
links.title: You: ""External.""
links.text: "External."
links.title: You: ""I have no idea what you're asking.""
links.text: "I have no idea what you're asking."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Answer the question, please.""
links.text: "Answer the question, please."
links.title: You: ""Wait, what's going on?""
links.text: "Wait, what's going on?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Never mind that. All you need to d..."
links.text: "Never mind that. All you need to do is repeat what you just said..."
links.title: Volition: "Do as she says. There's no other op..."
links.text: Do as she says. There's no other option.
links.title: You: ""This is going to sound crazy, but..."
links.text: "This is going to sound crazy, but the City of Revachol told me the world is going to end in 22 years."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Firewalker... can you... what do y..."
links.text: "Firewalker... can you... what do you mean?"
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, what in god's name are..."
links.text: "Detective, what in god's name are you doing?"
links.title: You: "(Whisper.) "Relax, Kim. I've *got*..."
links.text: (Whisper.) "Relax, Kim. I've *got* this."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Please acknowledge. What do you me..."
links.text: "Please acknowledge. What do you mean 'the world is going to end'?"
links.title: You: "(Whisper.) "They need to know the t..."
links.text: (Whisper.) "They need to know the truth, Kim. We can't keep it a secret!"
links.title: You: ""I mean exactly what I said. The wo..."
links.text: "I mean exactly what I said. The world is coming to an end. We have 22 years to prepare."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""And *how* do you know this?""
links.text: "And *how* do you know this?"
links.title: You: ""Like I said, the genius loci of Re..."
links.text: "Like I said, the genius loci of Revachol told me while I happened to be dancing in an abandoned church."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We see...""
links.text: "We see..."
links.title: You: ""So... when do I get to talk to the..."
links.text: "So... when do I get to talk to the Committee?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Firewalker, we must be perfectly h..."
links.text: "Firewalker, we must be perfectly honest with you: We cannot recommend that you address the Committee, not under the present circumstances, at least..."
links.title: You: ""Look, I was dancing in an abandone..."
links.text: "Look, I was dancing in an abandoned church and the City of Revachol spoke to me."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""And *what* did it say, exactly?""
links.text: "And *what* did it say, exactly?"
links.title: You: ""It's actually a 'she,' and she sai..."
links.text: "It's actually a 'she,' and she said the world is going to end in 22 years."
links.title: You: ""I'd really prefer to speak with th..."
links.text: "I'd really prefer to speak with the Committee directly."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We're afraid that won't be possibl..."
links.text: "We're afraid that won't be possible, Firewalker."
links.title: You: ""Why not?""
links.text: "Why not?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Because you're speaking like someo..."
links.text: "Because you're speaking like someone in the throes of a serious drug addiction. Your words have no connection to reality. You don't need to speak with the Committee, you need to speak with your station lazareth, *immediately*..."
links.title: Electrochemistry: "Get a load of Buzzkill FM over here..."
links.text: Get a load of Buzzkill FM over here. Are you really gonna give up the fun stuff just because some chick on the radio told you to?
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We will pass along a summary of yo..."
links.text: "We will pass along a summary of your report, minus any *speculative or paranatural* elements. What the Committee does from there is beyond our control..."
links.title: You: ""So... that's it?""
links.text: "So... that's it?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We're afraid so. But we must say t..."
links.text: "We're afraid so. But we must say that it has been... *a privilege* to speak with you. You've shown yourself to be a credit to the RCM, and we wish you good fortune and safety during the course of your work."
links.title: Empathy: "Her wishes are sincere. You can tak..."
links.text: Her wishes are sincere. You can take heart from that, at least.
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""That's correct. But we must say th..."
links.text: "That's correct. But we must say that it has been... *interesting* to speak with you. If nothing else, the RCM is frequently a source of curiosity to those of us aboard the Archer."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Now, the first signaller has infor..."
links.text: "Now, the first signaller has informed us that we must update the receiving frequency. This connection will be cleared in four... three..."
links.title: You: ""Wait, is there no other way?""
links.text: "Wait, is there no other way?"
links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Because what you are saying makes..."
links.text: "Because what you are saying makes no sense. From the sound of your voice, it appears that you have been under the influence of alcohol. It is our recommendation that you speak with your station lazareth *immediately* about treatment options..."
links.title: Electrochemistry: "Get a load of Buzzkill FM over here..."
links.text: Get a load of Buzzkill FM over here. Are you really gonna lay off the party sauce just because some chick on the radio told you to?
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Because what you're saying suggest..."
links.text: "Because what you're saying suggests that you are experiencing an acute psychic break with reality. You don't need to speak with the Committee, you need to speak with your station lazareth, *immediately*..."
links.title: Inland Empire: "No, no, no -- she's got it all back..."
links.text: No, no, no -- she's got it all backwards. It's reality that's *obscuring* what's real. You have never been closer to the dark truths of existence...
links.title: You: ""No, those are the facts as I have..."
links.text: "No, those are the facts as I have them."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Acknowledged. Please stand by whil..."
links.text: "Acknowledged. Please stand by while we transmit our summary to the Committee..."
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Kim Kitsuragi: ""... a long winter...""
links.text: "... a long winter..."
links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I'm not sure how much longer I can..."
links.text: "I'm not sure how much longer I can keep the signal clear, officer."
links.title: You: ""You have to, Soona. Just a little..."
links.text: "You have to, Soona. Just a little longer..."
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Horseback Antenna: "..."
Coalition Warship Archer: ""Firewalker, this is Coalition Wars..."
links.text: "Firewalker, this is Coalition Warship Archer, please acknowledge."
links.title: You: ""Yes, I'm here!""
links.text: "Yes, I'm here!"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Thank you for standing by. We are..."
links.text: "Thank you for standing by. We are authorised to report the Committee of Responsibility for Revachol has acknowledged *and accepted* your request."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""They would like you to address you..."
links.text: "They would like you to address your matter to the Committee *directly*, at their earliest convenience."
links.title: You: ""When is that?""
links.text: "When is that?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""*Subito*. Coalition Shuttle Laurel..."
links.text: "*Subito*. Coalition Shuttle Laurel is setting a course for your position. They will arrive momentarily. Stand by..."
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "To the southwest, one of the smalle..."
links.text: To the southwest, one of the smaller aerostatics that hovers above the city breaks from its holding pattern. Coalition Shuttle Laurel begins executing a slow turn, drawn by an invisible wire...
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "To the southwest, several stars beg..."
links.text: To the southwest, several stars begin to move in unison. The minor constellation of Coalition Shuttle Laurel begins executing a graceful turn, drawn by an invisible wire...
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The sky is grey and overcast."
links.text: The sky is grey and overcast.
links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""So... they're really coming...""
links.text: "So... they're really coming..."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant adjusts his micropho..."
links.text: The lieutenant adjusts his microphone and slowly looks up toward you.
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, what now?""
links.text: "Well, what now?"
links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You've accomplished your side task..."
links.text: "You've accomplished your side task, you've contacted Coalition Warship Archer. I suppose what I'm asking..."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... is whether we're about to lose..."
links.text: "... is whether we're about to lose you to the Moralintern."
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Beneath that surface query, a touch..."
links.text: Beneath that surface query, a touch of self-doubt. The lieutenant isn't sure he can solve the murder *without* you.
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... is how much further you plan t..."
links.text: "... is how much further you plan to take... *whatever this is*."
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The lieutenant is genuinely concern..."
links.text: The lieutenant is genuinely concerned. This is not a situation he ever thought he'd find himself in.
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... is when you're going to *drop..."
links.text: "... is when you're going to *drop this farce* and come back to work."
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Though you haven't exactly been a c..."
links.text: Though you haven't exactly been a credit to the investigation so far, the lieutenant doesn't want to be left in the cold, either.
links.title: You: ""Kim, have you ever considered that..."
links.text: "Kim, have you ever considered that maybe our case isn't that important?"
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't... what are you saying, de..."
links.text: "I don't... what are you saying, detective?"
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "What he means is, he can't believe..."
links.text: What he means is, he can't believe you're about to renounce your half-brothers and sisters.
links.title: You: ""That if we want to make *a real di..."
links.text: "That if we want to make *a real difference* in the world we have to look at *the real problems*."
links.title: You: ""That maybe *no one really cares* a..."
links.text: "That maybe *no one really cares* about the hanged man."
links.title: You: ""That maybe solving murders isn't w..."
links.text: "That maybe solving murders isn't worth the toll it takes on us, as people."
links.title: You: ""Kim, I'm tired of feeling like I d..."
links.text: "Kim, I'm tired of feeling like I don't have any *normal, reasonable* options."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What 'options'? What in god's name..."
links.text: "What 'options'? What in god's name are you talking about, detective?"
links.title: Volition: "Just let it all out. This might be..."
links.text: Just let it all out. This might be your last chance.
links.title: You: ""Everything is so *messy* down ther..."
links.text: "Everything is so *messy* down there. It's much nicer up here."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But you see, detective, that feeli..."
links.text: "But you see, detective, that feeling is simply an illusion caused by distance. Whether you choose to see it or not, the reality does not change."
links.title: You: ""You've got it backwards, Kim. Mayb..."
links.text: "You've got it backwards, Kim. Maybe it's only at a distance that you see things *as they really are*."
links.title: You: ""Then I choose the illusion.""
links.text: "Then I choose the illusion."
links.title: You: ""Haven't you noticed that things ha..."
links.text: "Haven't you noticed that things have only gotten *weirder* the longer we've been on this case?"
links.title: You: ""Some days I feel like I'm *trapped..."
links.text: "Some days I feel like I'm *trapped*, trapped in some sick game that I can't possibly win, and I don't want to play it anymore, Kim!"
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let me get this straight, detectiv..."
links.text: "Let me get this straight, detective: You're saying the only 'normal, reasonable' option available to you is to abandon your job and your life so you can fly away on a Moralintern warship?"
links.title: You: ""*Yes*, exactly.""
links.text: "*Yes*, exactly."
links.title: You: ""Yes, *exactly*.""
links.text: "Yes, *exactly*."
links.title: You: ""But I'm afraid, Kim.""
links.text: "But I'm afraid, Kim."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Afraid of what, detective?""
links.text: "Afraid of what, detective?"
links.title: Inland Empire: "A little rhyme jingling in your min..."
links.text: A little rhyme jingling in your mind's attic... "Of the future, of the past/ Of all that is not made to last"...
links.title: You: ""I feel that something *very* bad i..."
links.text: "I feel that something *very* bad is going to happen."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant takes a moment to co..."
links.text: The lieutenant takes a moment to compose his thoughts...
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't know where this case will..."
links.text: "I don't know where this case will lead us, detective, but in a sense that doesn't matter. Our job is to follow the evidence where it leads, consequences be damned..."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Because that's what it means to be..."
links.text: "Because that's what it means to be an officer of the RCM!"
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The lieutenant's final words are ne..."
links.text: The lieutenant's final words are nearly swallowed by the roar of the aerostatic's main rotors...
links.title: You: ""It's my past... it's going to catc..."
links.text: "It's my past... it's going to catch up with me."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant takes a moment to co..."
links.text: The lieutenant takes a moment to compose his thoughts...
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't know your history, detecti..."
links.text: "I don't know your history, detective, but I can say with great certainty that whatever you're running from won't disappear simply because you've abandoned your former life..."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Because the thing you're running f..."
links.text: "Because the thing you're running from is *inside you*, detective!"
links.title: You: ""Kim, what if *this* is all there i..."
links.text: "Kim, what if *this* is all there is?"
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant takes a moment to co..."
links.text: The lieutenant takes a moment to compose his thoughts...
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, each of us has our part..."
links.text: "Detective, each of us has our part to play in the world. My part is to solve crimes. I am under no illusion that my role isn't a minor one, in the scheme of things..."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But I embrace it *because* it's my..."
links.text: "But I embrace it *because* it's my role, and it's yours too, detective, whether you accept it or not!"
links.title: You: ""I guess we wait.""
links.text: "I guess we wait."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, and then?""
links.text: "Yes, and then?"
links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""I'm still not certain whether this..."
links.text: "I'm still not certain whether this was a *good* idea or not, but there is something extraordinary about summoning an aerostatic with your voice..."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""...someone has been maintaining it..."
links.text: "...someone has been maintaining it. The wiring has been repaired..."
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
You: "I wonder what Kim's up to now."
links.text: I wonder what Kim's up to now.
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The Whirling-in-Rags looms up to yo..."
links.text: The Whirling-in-Rags looms up to your right. The horseback monument is reflected vaguely in the grimy windows...
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The lieutenant is not in his room...."
links.text: The lieutenant is not in his room. He's found a little 24-hour cafe southeast of the roundabout. He's taking a break and reading the newspaper, after his usual fashion.
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "First he removes the games and puzz..."
links.text: First he removes the games and puzzles page and sets that aside for later. He never does the crossword during work hours.
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He reads everything on the front pa..."
links.text: He reads everything on the front page according to the size of the headline. Today, though, he only skims -- none of it seems very interesting.
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "When he's finished with the front p..."
links.text: When he's finished with the front page, he scans the local box scores. The Stormers lost again, 17-32. He shakes his head and checks his watch. It's time to get back to it...
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You think he's in his room, but do..."
links.text: You think he's in his room, but do you really know? No, you don't. You only know that he isn't here...
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The Whirling-in-Rags looms up to yo..."
links.text: The Whirling-in-Rags looms up to your right, a luminous cube against the nighttime...
links.title: Conceptualization: "As though the whole plaza were a gi..."
links.text: As though the whole plaza were a giant radiocomputer, and the hostel its glowing filament memory.
links.title: You: "Pretend you're riding the horse."
links.text: Pretend you're riding the horse.
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "You kick your feet but the horse, s..."
links.text: You kick your feet but the horse, strangely, does not move...
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "And yet, if you look up and squint..."
links.text: And yet, if you look up and squint just so, you can pretend that it's you who is approaching Coalition Shuttle Laurel, rather than the other way around...
links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""It's here.""
links.text: "It's here."
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The programmer's words are nearly s..."
links.text: The programmer's words are nearly swallowed by the roar of the Laurel's main rotors...
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Firewalker, this is Coalition Wars..."
links.text: "Firewalker, this is Coalition Warship Archer. We have been instructed to inform you that the Laurel arrived at your position. Please acknowledge."
links.title: Perception (Hearing): "No shit! How are they supposed to h..."
links.text: No shit! How are they supposed to hear your acknowledgement over the thundering of their own rotors?
links.title: You: ""Acknowledged, Archer. This is Fire..."
links.text: "Acknowledged, Archer. This is Firewalker."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Thank you. The Committee of Respon..."
links.text: "Thank you. The Committee of Responsibility for Revachol has authorised us to offer you an immediate extraction. Do you accept?"
links.title: You: ""Hold on, I have a few questions fi..."
links.text: "Hold on, I have a few questions first."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We are far past that point, Firewa..."
links.text: "We are far past that point, Firewalker. There is only one question now: Are you ready, or are you not?"
links.title: You: "Look around, one last time."
links.text: Look around, one last time.
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The roundabout, Martinaise North, d..."
links.text: The roundabout, Martinaise North, daytime. Across the plaza, a pair of seagulls fight over the remains of a chicken wing.
links.title: Perception (Sight): "It's the same plaza you've been loo..."
links.text: It's the same plaza you've been looking at for days. What do you hope to see now that you haven't before?
links.title: Soona, the Programmer: "The programmer eyes you curiously...."
links.text: The programmer eyes you curiously. She does not understand why you're hesitating.
links.title: Empathy: "Whatever her misgivings about the C..."
links.text: Whatever her misgivings about the Coalition, the fact is that you've summoned an aerostatic with your voice. An achievement she never thought she'd witness...
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks up toward you...."
links.text: The lieutenant looks up toward you. He starts to open his mouth, then appears to think better of it.
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He's spoken his peace, he thinks. I..."
links.text: He's spoken his peace, he thinks. It's up to you now.
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant isn't looking at you..."
links.text: The lieutenant isn't looking at you or at the massive aerostatic hovering less than 20 metres above him. He appears to be concentrating on the braid of cables running from the amplifier.
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He does not expect you to remain. A..."
links.text: He does not expect you to remain. And why should he?
links.title: Esprit de Corps: "But where is your half-brother, the..."
links.text: But where is your half-brother, the lieutenant? He should be here...
links.title: Shivers: "YOU CANNOT LEAVE. SO MUCH HANGS IN..."
links.text: YOU CANNOT LEAVE. SO MUCH HANGS IN THE BALANCE.
links.title: Shivers: "There is something, a whisper, circ..."
links.text: There is something, a whisper, circulating among the city's footnoted alleyways and along its electrical wires, but what it's saying, you can't tell. It seems to be a message meant for someone else...
links.title: Noid: "The speedfreak eyes you with a curi..."
links.text: The speedfreak eyes you with a curious blend of awe and contempt.
links.title: Empathy: "He's torn. There's nothing more *so..."
links.text: He's torn. There's nothing more *soft core* than the Coalition, according to his worldview, and yet, having summoned an aerostatic with your voice is one of the most *hard core* feats imaginable...
links.title: You: ""I accept, Archer. Get me out of he..."
links.text: "I accept, Archer. Get me out of here." (Board the aerostatic.)
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Acknowledged. Laurel has initiated..."
links.text: "Acknowledged. Laurel has initiated the extraction procedure. Stand by..."
links.title: Horseback Antenna: ""Marianne hat mir erzählt, dass Osk..."
links.text: "Marianne hat mir erzählt, dass Oskar nicht mehr derselbe ist, seit er auf einem Luftschiff... zurückgekommen ist..."
links.title: You: ""I... can't do it." (Back out.)"
links.text: "I... can't do it." (Back out.)
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Repeat that, Firewalker? What do y..."
links.text: "Repeat that, Firewalker? What do you mean 'you can't'? Are you being impeded in some way?"
links.title: You: ""It's my case, I've got to see it t..."
links.text: "It's my case, I've got to see it through."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We have to say, this is *extremely..."
links.text: "We have to say, this is *extremely* disappointing to hear, Firewalker..."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""What the consequences will be for..."
links.text: "What the consequences will be for your refusal to accept responsibility, we cannot say. For your sake, we pray they are not more than we all can bear."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""And now, we are updating our frequ..."
links.text: "And now, we are updating our frequencies. We will not speak again. This connection will be cleared in four... three..."
links.title: You: ""I'm sorry, Archer.""
links.text: "I'm sorry, Archer."
links.title: You: ""Wait! I've changed my--""
links.text: "Wait! I've changed my--"
links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""What the consequences will be for..."
links.text: "What the consequences will be for your refusal to accept responsibility, we cannot say. For your sake, we pray they are not more than we all can bear."
links.title: You: ""It's Kim, my partner, I can't aban..."
links.text: "It's Kim, my partner, I can't abandon him."
links.title: You: ""There's still some... personal bus..."
links.text: "There's still some... personal business I have to sort out."
links.title: Noid: ""Here they are.""
links.text: "Here they are."
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "The speedfreak's words are nearly s..."
links.text: The speedfreak's words are nearly swallowed by the roar of the Laurel's main rotors...
links.title: You: "Keep waiting."
links.text: Keep waiting.
links.title: Horseback Antenna: "..."
Horseback Antenna: "..."
Noid: ""Listen, no matter what happens whe..."
links.text: "Listen, no matter what happens when they get hold of you, don't you *dare* rat out the hard core underground..."
links.title: Noid: ""No way. Big Bad's coming here...""
links.text: "No way. Big Bad's coming here..."
links.title: You: ""Just tell me where to meet them.""
links.text: "Just tell me where to meet them."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Remain where you are. Coalition Sh..."
links.text: "Remain where you are. Coalition Shuttle Laurel is setting a course for your position. They will arrive momentarily. Stand by..."
links.title: You: ""When is that? I'm kind of in the m..."
links.text: "When is that? I'm kind of in the middle of a murder investigation..."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Local matters can wait. Coalition..."
links.text: "Local matters can wait. Coalition Shuttle Laurel is setting a course for your position. They will arrive momentarily. Stand by..."
links.title: You: ""Archer, I can't hold on much longe..."
links.text: "Archer, I can't hold on much longer..."
links.title: Inland Empire: "No, you *know* this tone of voice...."
links.text: No, you *know* this tone of voice. You've heard it before. She's about to deliver some bad news...
links.title: You: ""Why do I feel like you're about to..."
links.text: "Why do I feel like you're about to tell me something I don't want to hear?"
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We're sorry, Firewalker. The Commi..."
links.text: "We're sorry, Firewalker. The Committee has declined your request for an emergency address..."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Specifically, they said that 'disp..."
links.text: "Specifically, they said that 'disputes of purely local concern' do not fall under their purview..."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""I... cannot say we agree, speaking..."
links.text: "I... cannot say we agree, speaking for a moment in strictly personal terms. You have convinced us that the situation in Martinaise is untenable, but we are only the second signaller, and there is no appealing the Committee's decision..."
links.title: Empathy: "Something has cracked in her founda..."
links.text: Something has cracked in her foundation. Her faith in the Moralintern is no longer as firm as it had been...
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""They added that they expect the RC..."
links.text: "They added that they expect the RCM to fulfil its responsibilities 'to a high degree of satisfaction'..."
links.title: You: ""Well, thank you for trying at leas..."
links.text: "Well, thank you for trying at least."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We're sorry we did not come bearin..."
links.text: "We're sorry we did not come bearing better news. But we must say that it has been... *a privilege* to speak with you. We believe you are a credit to the RCM, and we wish you good fortune and safety during the course of your work."
links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""You're welcome. We must say that i..."
links.text: "You're welcome. We must say that it has been... *interesting* to speak with you. If nothing else, the RCM is frequently a source of curiosity to those of us aboard the Archer."
links.title: You: ""I'm here, Archer! What's the news?""
links.text: "I'm here, Archer! What's the news?"
links.title: Noid: ""Signals are starting to misalign...."
links.text: "Signals are starting to misalign. Not sure how much longer I can hold them together..."
links.title: You: ""You have to, Noid. Just a little l..."
links.text: "You have to, Noid. Just a little longer..."

links.title: You: ""What's more, I believe the Union h..."
links.text: "What's more, I believe the Union has been trying to escalate the situation so that they can *seize control of the entire harbour*."

links.title: You: ""I've also uncovered evidence the U..."
links.text: "I've also uncovered evidence the Union may also be orchestrating a *takeover* of a local fishing village."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We have it. Is there anything else..."
links.text: "We have it. Is there anything else the Committee should know?" You hear the sound of her pen scratching against paper.

links.title: You: ""And, well, the Union's demands for..."
links.text: "And, well, the Union's demands for worker control of corporate boards seem completely unworkable!"

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Hmmm. Was there anything else the..."
links.text: "Hmmm. Was there anything else the Committee should know?" If she's writing, you can't hear anything.

links.title: You: ""The Wild Pines has recently lost c..."
links.text: "The Wild Pines has recently lost control of a paramilitary death squad called Krenel..."

links.title: You: ""For one, the Wild Pines has been c..."
links.text: "For one, the Wild Pines has been completely shut-out of the strike negotiations..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Yes? Please continue." You can hea..."
links.text: "Yes? Please continue." You can hear the sound of her scribbling some notes...

links.title: You: ""I haven't worked out the details y..."
links.text: "I haven't worked out the details yet, but there's something *weird* going on with the Wild Pines..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Yes? What else?" You can hear her..."
links.text: "Yes? What else?" You can hear her impatiently tapping her pen against a metal desk...

links.title: Logic: "You may not have the *whole* story..."
links.text: You may not have the *whole* story just yet, but you might still convey the seriousness of the situation.

links.title: Logic: "There are still some *holes* in you..."
links.text: There are still some *holes* in your theory of the case, so best just to be clear about what you know and what you don't.

links.title: You: ""I've uncovered things in the cours..."
links.text: "I've uncovered things in the course of my investigation that lead me to believe we're headed to a violent confrontation between the Union and the Wild Pines..."

links.title: You: ""Things are really bad down here. L..."
links.text: "Things are really bad down here. Like, *really* bad."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We need to know more than that. No..."
links.text: "We need to know more than that. Now, please describe the situation in as much detail as you can. We will forward our summary to the Committee."

links.title: You: ""Damn it, there's no time to explai..."
links.text: "Damn it, there's no time to explain! You better write this down..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Watch your tone. Now, please descr..."
links.text: "Watch your tone. Now, please describe the situation in as much detail as you can. We will forward our summary to the Committee."

links.title: Empathy: "What part of 'need to reach the Com..."
links.text: What part of 'need to reach the Committee' doesn't she understand? Time to lay it all out.

links.title: You: ""You aren't listening. I've got an..."
links.text: "You aren't listening. I've got an *urgent personal matter* to discuss with the Committee."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: "A loud sigh fills the channel. "We..."
links.text: A loud sigh fills the channel. "We will hear your request, Firewalker, although we must inform you that the Committee does not typically intervene in *personal* matters..."

links.title: Empathy: "That's only because they haven't he..."
links.text: That's only because they haven't heard about *your* problems yet.

links.title: You: "(Whisper.) "I'm investigating a mur..."
links.text: (Whisper.) "I'm investigating a murder *and I think I did it*."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""We're not sure we heard that clear..."
links.text: "We're not sure we heard that clearly. Are you suggesting that you may be responsible for the very murder you're investigating?"

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I did it. And I need you to..."
links.text: "Yeah, I did it. And I need you to stop me before I do it again."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""For the last time, detective. You...."
links.text: "For the last time, detective. You. Did. Not. Commit. The. Murder. Archer, please disregard his nonsense."

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""Archer can't hear us, I'm afraid...."
links.text: "Archer can't hear us, I'm afraid. Only his microphone is connected to the transceiver."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't understand. I thought he w..."
links.text: "I don't understand. I thought he was making progress..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Firewalker, surely you are aware t..."
links.text: "Firewalker, surely you are aware that it is a civil offence to maliciously or frivolously obstruct a Coalition radio frequency..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This absolute lunatic! But why am..."
links.text: "This absolute lunatic! But why am I surprised?"

links.title: Noid: ""No use. The Big Bad can't hear us,..."
links.text: "No use. The Big Bad can't hear us, just the main cop."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, what in god's name are..."
links.text: "Detective, what in god's name are you saying? Archer, please disregard that..."

links.title: You: ""I'm not *sure* it was me, it's mor..."
links.text: "I'm not *sure* it was me, it's more like a working hypothesis."

links.title: You: ""It's this partner of mine. He's *r..."
links.text: "It's this partner of mine. He's *really* been riding my ass."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Please confirm. Are you saying you..."
links.text: "Please confirm. Are you saying your partner is somehow *impeding* your investigation?"

links.title: You: ""Nah, he's a solid investigator. In..."
links.text: "Nah, he's a solid investigator. In fact, we get along great apart from the ass-riding."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you completely out of your min..."
links.text: "Are you completely out of your mind, detective? Archer, please give us a moment!"

links.title: Soona, the Programmer: ""They can't hear us, I'm afraid. On..."
links.text: "They can't hear us, I'm afraid. Only his microphone is connected to the transceiver."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't understand. I thought he w..."
links.text: "I don't understand. I thought he was making progress..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This absolute lunatic! But why am..."
links.text: "This absolute lunatic! But why am I surprised?"

links.title: Noid: ""No use. The Big Bad can't hear us,..."
links.text: "No use. The Big Bad can't hear us, just the main cop."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Firewalker, surely you are aware t..."
links.text: "Firewalker, surely you are aware that it is a civil offence to maliciously or frivolously obstruct a Coalition radio frequency..."

links.title: Coalition Warship Archer: ""Now, please excuse us while we upd..."
links.text: "Now, please excuse us while we update the receiving frequency. This connection will be cleared in four... three..."

links.title: Half Light: "She can't treat you that way! Let h..."
links.text: She can't treat you that way! Let her know what you *really think* of her!

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Quick, hang up on her first!"
links.text: Quick, hang up on her first!

links.title: You: ""Go ahead and leave, you stupid who..."
links.text: "Go ahead and leave, you stupid whore!"

links.title: Horseback Antenna: "... and the line goes quiet."
links.text: ... and the line goes quiet.

links.title: Interfacing: "She must have cleared the connectio..."
links.text: She must have cleared the connection a few seconds early...
links.title: Volition: "You didn't have to do that, you kno..."
links.text: You didn't have to do that, you know. There were *other* options...
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant slowly removes his h..."
links.text: The lieutenant slowly removes his headset and turns to you.
links.title: You: ""Kim, why did I call that woman a w..."
links.text: "Kim, why did I call that woman a whore, just now?"
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You really don't know?""
links.text: "You really don't know?"
links.title: You: ""Maybe I *do* know, it's just... ha..."
links.text: "Maybe I *do* know, it's just... hard to talk about."
links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, I imagine it must be.""
